programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second programme this year from RAF Coningsby in Lincolnshire, and discovers the story of a length of tree that ended up inside a Lancaster bomber. Treasures brought in to be valued include a harp that survived the French Revolution, a curious wooden item with an unexpected purpose, a diamond brooch found hidden inside a barometer and a pair of Second World War propaganda posters printed on hessian sacking.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Walmer castle, Kent, and is challenged to identify a valuable 18th-century glass out of a collection of reproductions. Other items brought in to be valued include a rare pottery piglet, a revolving table with secret compartments, a British PoW's diary, a set of French fashion illustrations from the 1920s, a table clock and a collection of Victorian ceramic birds.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: The story of a chest full of jewels hidden in a Prussian castle that was later requisitioned by the US army as a base, and the plot by American officers to steal the loot.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A vast project in the icy wilderness of southern Alaska, and a landscape of confusing and surprising structures that represented a bold statement of Spain's plans for the future.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores St Pancras station in London and its sister hotel - built to show off the might of the Midlands, and learns about Castle Howard station in North Yorkshire.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright feels neglected by Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, and decides to feign an illness in an attempt to get her undivided attention, but she soon sees through the ruse.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright decides to buy a guard dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. Meanwhile, Jed's scarecrow in the barn is mistaken for a human body, and Marlene enrols on a mail-order reiki healing course as part of a plan to create a massage parlour and beauty salon at the farm.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler is left cold by all the kerfuffle as the family awaits the arrival of his French exchange student. He even considers getting engaged to Beth in a bid to get out of paying a return visit to France. However, the guest's eventual arrival causes a stir all round. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie's competitive spirit is fired up when a broke Llewellyn challenges him to a pub quiz with a £5,000 jackpot - but sadly, Bryan, Jed and Marlene's general knowledge leaves a lot to be desired. Tyler tries to make amends after Beth accuses him of being anti-Welsh. Comedy, starring John Challis.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Walmer Castle in Kent, where the team values a jacket worn by President Kennedy that could be one of the most valuable items ever featured on the series. Other items brought in include an art deco mask that terrifies its owner's children, an enamel advertising sign, and a letter from Lord Nelson that has an unexpected connection to the owner's dead husband.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second visit in this series to Plas Newydd on the Isle of Anglesey. The team examine rarities including a cabinet with a secret function, a magazine rack made by celebrated designer Piero Fornasetti, a collection of historical items related to deafness, a Chinese silver punchbowl and a photo that has a connection to the Apollo 11 mission.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: The stories of two murderers in London and Berlin, who both took advantage of the Blackouts during the Second World War to commit their crimes undetected.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: David Jason: My Life on Screen
programme.desc: The actor looks back at his transition from supporting roles to leads, and the early days of Only Fools and Horses.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The stories of famous hoaxes, featuring personal accounts of those who perpetrated and exposed them, beginning with the infamous alien autopsy footage.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheepshead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know

programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: A look at the making of the prison sitcom, originally shown to coincide with its 40th anniversary. Writers Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais guide cameras around the pivotal places they visited during the creation and development of the series, including the pub where they first met, the prisons they researched, and the filming locations they used. Plus, contributions by the show's admirers, surviving members of the cast and members of the production crew.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick is informed that the Communists have kidnapped his sausage and are demanding a ransom, and a plan is devised for René to pay it.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick interrogates Gruber about The Fallen Madonna with the Big Boobies and Rene repays Monsieur Alphonse using forged notes. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Guy Siner and Richard Gibson.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Three brave rescue attempts are launched when the dastardly Von Klinkerhoffen catches Maria and the Fallen Madonna, and the General discovers the sausage and hangs it in his closet.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. Valuables brought in to be viewed include a collection of medals from both World Wars presented to a man who also rescued survivors from the Titanic, an art nouveau mirror and a 16th-century bottle that survived being unearthed by a digger.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Guy Walters explores Hitler's plans for the future after the Second World War, beginning by revealing what Britain under Nazi occupation would have looked like.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. He begins by travelling from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, to Stratford-upon-Avon in Warwickshire, finding out about the remarkable craftsmen behind the Victorian furniture trade, discovering how George Bradshaw helped save Britain's canal heritage and seeing Shakespeare through the eyes of a 19th-century rail tourist.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns how the railways helped to make Birmingham the pen-making capital of the world, hears the chilling tale of one of 19th-century Britain's most notorious murderers and samples delicacies concocted in a Victorian kitchen at Shugborough Hall, Staffordshire.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorset's Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lyme's famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouth's uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day recreates the case of a soldier who returned from the front line of the Second World War with a terrible urge to kill.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at children's Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the house's gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When a government minister is killed by a fire in a London hotel, terrorists are suspected of starting the blaze _ until Leo discovers a wad of notes on the MP's bed. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan tries to uncover the truth, but finds her investigations are hampered by a former schoolfriend who claims to work for the Cabinet Office. Amanda Burton and William Gaminara star.

programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. Billy is shocked when he gets the job at the factory, David and Megan come to terms with their news, and Nathan lands himself in trouble. Drama, guest starring Elaine Paige.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon tries to make the best of her job at the bakery and Dorien joins the Open University, while Tracey continues to study at the school of hard knocks. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible 'test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A local journalist tries to convince the people of Lighthaven there is a big cat on the moors, but nobody will believe him - until the discovery of his mauled body.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to rescue a familiar face, and a collapsing building traps an elderly woman. Starring Andrew Kazamia and Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy attends a district nurses' conference in Scarborough, where she surprises everyone - including herself - with her instinctive knack for public speaking. Ruth, who's also along for the trip, spends the night at a former boyfriend's flat - but returns to Skelthwaite with a clear conscience. Drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Walter soon feels the heat when he manages to set his flat on fire, Simon clashes with Ruth over her commitment to the job and Peggy finally reaches an understanding with her son Stephen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Pru from the Embassy visits Barry in jail and reassures the gang they are doing everything they can to free him - but the Cubans have discovered his Russian connections and convinced themselves he is a spy. Neville feels the pressure as he is forced to home in on his target, and Oz faces a major setback in his relationship with Ofelia. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A terrified Neville is kidnapped, driven through the back streets of Havana and deposited at an empty house - where he is greeted by Pru from the Embassy, who asks him to trap rogue operative Tarquin. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Barry being released from jail, and his deteriorating condition prompts Oz to make a heartbreaking decision. Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star as chalk-and-cheese detectives determined to find the killer of a once-promising rugby player's wife. Clues point to the husband - but the duo suspect it could be part of a conspiracy. Adapted by Alan Plater from Reginald Hill's award-winning crime novels, with Ralph Brown and Susannah Corbett.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A couple stumble upon the body of an elderly man in the old hospital wing of an abandoned mental health facility, strapped to a gurney with electrodes connected to his temples.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. After risking his life in a burning building following a quiet word from Keats, Ray gets personally involved in the high-profile investigation - which forces him to face his traumatic past as it becomes clear the tragic events of the Falklands War are driving the firestarter to murder. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. Chris falls for the attractive undercover officer, but his feelings prompt a violent outburst that threatens his future in the police, and Alex gathers more clues about why she remains in the 1980s. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Robert tries to arrange a love-match between Eleanor and one of his old comrades-in-arms, but meets with a conspicuous lack of success. Then a belligerent boxer with head injuries gives him an unexpected helping hand, and medicine starts taking a back seat to romance at the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Regina and George return to Ash Park from their wedding, and are warned about their marriage of convenience by Elizabeth and Carolyn. Meanwhile, Sarah attempts to arrange Rene's funeral and is offered emotional and practical support by Roy and Doris Collins. Elsewhere, Gino accidentally finds and reads Ann's novel, and Elizabeth is invited to a function in Sydney by Douglas Goddard.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George consummates his marriage to Regina after she spikes his drink with morphine, and warns her it will never happen again. Sarah returns to work at the hospital, although Jack worries it is too soon after Rene's death, and Douglas invites Elizabeth to accompany him on holiday.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Relishing the social prestige it confers, Hyacinth decides that she and husband Richard should have a weekend at a golfing hotel so that she can keep up with the Major and his wife. Roy Clarke's suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is thrown into dismay when her beloved father goes to the register office to be married, and things go from bad to worse when her neighbour Emmett comes face to face with her uncouth relatives, Daisy, Onslow and Rose.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth dreads the idea of attending Onslow's birthday celebrations. However, she changes her mind when she learns a limousine will be arriving to take her to the party. Starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Fairley and Harrow are sent to the Outback to investigate a multiple-death car collision in Fairley's home town of Eurella Creek. When Fairley finds out that Harrow slept with Grace, he bluntly tells him he has a tendency to ruin people's lives. Harrow also learns that Fairley is a local hero for rescuing three children from a house fire in 1991, but still feels guilty about failing to rescue the fourth one. Maxine confronts Grace about not facing the demons of her past. Australian drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The team is drawn into the world of a strict religious sect when a father and son are murdered with copies of the Bible at their sides. Burke grows increasingly irate as the secretive community closes ranks, refusing to speak to non-members, and he suspects the leader James Hardie knows more about the killings than he is letting on. Meanwhile, Reid investigates the disappearance of an old friend's daughter and uncovers a link to Burke's case. Detective drama, guest starring Sandy Morton, with Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Pathologist Duncan Clark (Davood Ghadami) begins work with Burke and Reid on the case of a tortured and mutilated body found in a vacant warehouse. After identifying the victim as newly qualified doctor Scott Clarkson, they discover he may been involved in a drugs scam, but the investigation is complicated by the unexpected arrival of London cops DI Casey and DS Moretti. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Reece Dinsdale (Coronation Street) and Steve John Shepherd (Plus One), with Blythe Duff, John Michie and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Dalziel witnesses a shooting through a neighbour's window and rushes to the scene to find a dead woman, whose husband is suspected of being responsible for the incident. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Michael Kitchen and Josette Simon.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy says farewell to the Fusiliers. Complications during a live firing exercise results in a secret coming up to the surface. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. As Marsha's troubles deepen, she finds solace in a bottle and spurns all offers of help from her friends, while Williams and Phillips' relationship reaches a turning point.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dale Smith ignores a warning from lover Louise to save his own skin and foolishly continues searching Larson's home for the gun used in the Garrison shooting. When he fails to show up at Sun Hill, Nadir is forced to tell Jack Meadows what has been going on. Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Enigmatic new consultant Dan Clifford turns up at the hospital and examines the kidney transplant case, while a worried Abra covers his tracks. Elliot is forced to finally confront his demons over Gina's death and Connie reveals she is pregnant to a stunned Sam. Medical drama, with Peter Wingfield and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney treats a group of Spice Girl lookalikes, and Andrew tries to calm an irate Duffy who announced she's having the baby whether he likes it or not. Meanwhile, Holly receives another gift from her secret admirer, and suspects Patrick may be behind the offering. Starring Cathy Shipton, Philip Bretherton and Ronnie McCann.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant and Phil have a word of warning for Richard, while Ian has a surprise for Cindy.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelley thinks that a holiday might help her relationship, but Mark has other ideas. Arthur is having car trouble, and Grant gets an unexpected visitor.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote goes metal detecting. Meanwhile, A fire that has broken out at a house ends in tragedy, and Gregg steals the show at Jaffa's talent contest.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The three doctors fall out when a consultant refuses to operate on their heart patient because he is a heavy smoker. Jack is unhappy because Beth has rejected his proposal and Will's marriage suffers another setback. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally is shocked by news of Megan's pregnancy and her mood is soured further by the discovery that Kim already knows about it. Work matters prove just as complicated when the nurses help a teenager in need of a kidney transplant whose health is further threatened by tensions between potential organ donors in her family. Guest starring Frances Barber and Stella Gonet alongside Samantha Giles, Holly Grainger and Denise Van Outen.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: An activity weekend lands Dorien in hospital - where she is mortified that the private doctors might think she fraternises with the likes of Sharon and Tracey. Veteran TV weatherman Ian McCaskill appears as himself.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey reprimands DeVere for not fulfilling his duties as lord of the manor when he fails to attend church on Sunday, but then forgets to practise what she preaches. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo speculates why blood rushes to the head when upside down but not to the feet while standing up, so Seymour sets up an experiment to demonstrate the way the body works. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Dalziel meets an attractive British singer during a European police conference, but wakes up to find her dead and himself accused of murder. Released on bail, he begins inquiries into the case which yield a complex story of diamond dealing and police corruption. Michael French guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Home Office asks Sam and her team to re-examine the work of an independent pathologist. Harry's patience is tested to the limit by the investigation. Feature-length crime drama, starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads reach South Africa where they help complete the building of a medical centre, leading to romance for Jeremy, who falls for one of the nurses. Meanwhile, Andy Butcher lands himself in deep trouble after a kind-hearted gesture to help a destitute local family leads to accusations of ivory-poaching.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: New consultant Dan continues to put pressure on Abra while he is digging for dirt about the kidney transplant. Sam locks horns with Connie over the future of their baby and Mark punishes himself for Tricia's death. Medical drama, starring Peter Wingfield and Adrian Edmondson.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Spencer runs into an old Navy colleague while attending a funeral - only to find he has a much younger, pregnant fiancee whose father is hot on his heels. Patrick arrives when the girl is suffering chest pains, and the pair are held hostage by the disapproving parent. Medical drama series, starring Ian Kelsey and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Worried about his future position at Sun Hill, DC Carver maps out a new career. However, his colleagues are a little sceptical about his plan. Iain Fletcher stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A ghost from Kathy's past returns to haunt her, Richard has a date with an old flame, and Mark is exasperated by Shelley's behaviour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kathy makes a decision which changes her life, while Ricky leaves Frank speechless when he describes his new job.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch face a tough challenge when a fire breaks out in an indoor market. Meanwhile, Carol takes romance a step further.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack is caught in a dilemma when he has to tell his best friends that Chloe has cancer, and his relationship with Beth continues to deteriorate, prompting her to make radical decisions about her future. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally bans Megan from seeing Luke and makes her feelings about her daughter's pregnancy very clear, which only serves to bring the teenagers closer together. A team-building exercise for the factory workers reaches a dramatic climax and the nurses help a woman suffering from alopecia come clean about her relationship with a younger man. Guest starring Jan Francis and Chris Bisson.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey discovers more than she bargained for while sorting out jumble for a car-boot sale after chancing upon an old photo album. Linda Robson stars.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere moves his multinational grocery business to the manor and clashes with Audrey over the removal of a fireplace that he considers ugly and she believes is intrinsic to the property. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Seymour visit an old friend in hospital following his hernia operation and go to extraordinary lengths to cheer him up. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star in the first episode to feature Clem 'Smiler' Hemmingway (Stephen Lewis).

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge must decide the fate of a sick baby which has been refused further resuscitation by doctors. The infant's deeply religious parents disagree, and take the fight for their son's life to court. Meanwhile, a boy convicted of theft dies in custody - bringing Deed's own traumatic memories of childhood to the fore. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sam, Chris, Andre and Vince pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie is left panicked when Andrea and Millie disappear, while Nate approaches Rhona with a proposition, suggesting they split half the restaurant order with Butlers. Brenda seeks an apology from Amelia for egging her window, but when Amelia maintains her innocence, Kerry tells Brenda to clear off.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya makes a shocking discovery regarding Geoff, Asha's problems follow her to her new school and Roy invites Shona to move into his flat.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: In the sixth and final episode, the brothers prepare to say their goodbyes to Mumbai, but before they leave, they are invited to appear on a local news report. For their final stop in the city, the boys meet 85-year-old Norma Otter, who was a team-mate of Dougie's international hockey star aunt, Pansy Thomas. Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a nine-month-old terrier who was found wandering the streets whilst heavily pregnant, before spending time with a three-month-old puppy called Pancake, who is having problems with his eyesight. Elsewhere, a dog arrives at Battersea who was found dumped with a terrible case of mange and an injured leg.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. As well as forgotten gems from the telly archives, his 1980s fashion choices and hairstyles, viewers will also get to relive those moments of TV gold that have turned him into one of the country's most adored stars. Presented by Jason Manford.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: John Barnes and Matt Le Tissier were both flying the flag for England in the recent ITV show Harry's Heroes - but now they're on different sides as they take part in the knockout quiz, captaining teams comprising members of their own families in a bid to make it through to the next round. At stake for the eventual winners is £25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The Chase star Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty is the one asking the questions for once.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: As life in lockdown continues, the financial journalist presents more advice for people who have found themselves living with financial uncertainty. Martin answers viewers' questions on how the economic crisis affects family finances, jobs and consumer rights.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the heart-stopping story of a man who took a ‘pleasure flight' on a hang-glider. Two passengers on board the Viking Sky cruise ship that suffered engine failure in rough seas just off the coast of Norway recount how they were left fearing for their lives, while a heroic cop throws the rulebook out of the window when trying to save a baby's life on the roadside.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.sub-title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories: Alesha Dixon
programme.desc: The singer and Britain's Got Talent judge chats about her career and personal life, opening up to Piers about how, after finding fame with Mis-Teeq and as a solo artist, she lost her record contract and found out her husband was having an affair, all in the space of a few weeks. She speaks about being on the receiving end of a backlash after replacing Arlene Phillips on Strictly Come Dancing, and reveals how she juggles motherhood with songwriting and her TV work.

There's just one little snag - the only available room is Dorien's - and she is somewhat dismayed to be told that family comes first. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph, with a guest appearance from Kate Williams (Love Thy Neighbour).

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joe's home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle.

programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by guests Roman Kemp and Vick Hope, and chefs Marcus Wareing, Jose Pizarro and Bettina Campolucci Bordi. Featuring recipes for chicken pithivier and cheesecake, and a masterclass in the best way to prepare steak.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner bring their favourite flavours of Greece to the UK, preparing rack of lamb, prawn saganaki pies, a cheat's moussaka and a deceptively easy baklava.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The TV chef begins the Texan leg of his American adventure by visiting a place with more than a hint of Mexican spice, as San Antonio was once a part of Mexico. Amidst the wonders of the city, James tries fresh churros and a traditional barbecoa - Mexican barbecue.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present behind-closed-doors coverage, including the 3.35 Qipco 2,000 Guineas Stakes from Newmarket, plus races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00, and races at 2.05, 2.40 and 3.15 from Newcastle. With analysis from Jason Weaver and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: A chance to catch the original US version of the show in which mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Butterfly, Egg, Thingamajig and Skeleton take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Nick Nairn for a trip aboard luxury train the Royal Scotsman. During the journey, James visits the train's kitchens to prepare a traditional duck a l'orange. Along the way they stop off at a bakery in a former prisoner of war camp and historic Scone Palace, where they prepare ham and cheese toastie in the grounds.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner bring their favourite flavours of Greece to the UK, preparing rack of lamb, prawn saganaki pies, a cheat's moussaka and a deceptively easy baklava.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan shows how to grow a summer feast of strawberries, even if the only space available is a doorstep, and family-friendly ways to grow delicious vegetables. His Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney join in from their homes with clever hacks and tips to get viewers making the most out of their gardens, window boxes or windowsills.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: John Barnes and Matt Le Tissier were both flying the flag for England in the recent ITV show Harry's Heroes - but now they're on different sides as they take part in the knockout quiz, captaining teams comprising members of their own families in a bid to make it through to the next round. At stake for the eventual winners is £25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The Chase star Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty is the one asking the questions for once.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Coverage of today's race meetings.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Jurassic Park III (2001)
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Dr Alan Grant is lured to a dinosaur-infested island by a divorced couple who offer to fund his research, unaware their real motive is to find their missing son - and that the creatures on the island are far more intelligent than anyone suspected. Action adventure sequel, starring Sam Neill, William H Macy, Tea Leoni and Alessandro Nivola.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
programme.desc: Three years after the destruction of Jurassic World, Owen Grady and Claire Dearing are asked to return to the theme park to save its resident dinosaurs from the island's active volcano. During their mission, they uncover a conspiracy that may affect the entire planet. Action sequel, starring Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Rafe Spall and Toby Jones.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. As well as forgotten gems from the telly archives, his 1980s fashion choices and hairstyles, viewers will also get to relive those moments of TV gold that have turned him into one of the country's most adored stars. Presented by Jason Manford.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Live interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.
